trial_identification.studytitle: The water birth versus land birth study for pregnant women at low-risk of complications
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Water birth Access at Term to Estimate Risks and Benefits In Research cohorTs in Hospital (WATERBIRTH): prospective cohort feasibility study

interventions.interventions: Participants who intend to have a water birth on admission to birth suite will be allocated to a room with water birth facilities and have one-to-one care in labour by a midwife who is credentialed to conduct water births in accordance with evidence-informed guidelines. Women may access water immersion in labour and in the absence of an indication to exit the pool; the woman will proceed to give birth under water.
interventions.comparator: Participants who intend to have a land birth on admission to birth suite will be allocated to a room with access to a bath for water immersion but no facilities for water birth. Women will have one-to-one care in labour by a midwife credentialed in water immersion and may use water immersion in the first stage of labour if they wish. Women who use the bath will be asked to exit the bath at the onset of second stage labour and give birth to their babies 'on land' in a position of their choice.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number and proportion of women who are: 1) potentially eligible / ineligible 2) recruited / not recruited [two outcomes]
primaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of recruitment by extraction from study's database and hospital's electronic perinatal database

primaryOutcome.outcome: Of women who are eligible on admission to birth suite; the number of women who intend to water birth and do not intend to water birth
primaryOutcome.timepoint: On admission to birth suite by extraction from the hospital's electronic perinatal database

primaryOutcome.outcome: Of women who are eligible at onset of second stage labour; the number of women who intend to water birth and do not intend to water birth
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At onset of second stage labour by extraction from the hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maternal baseline characteristics: age, ethnicity, level of education, gravida and parity, feeding intention at booking, medical history, body mass index (BMI), smoking status, Edinburgh Depression Score (EDS), Haemoglobin [ten separate outcomes].
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Collected at hospital booking visit for the index pregnancy by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Augmentation of labour (ARM and/or oxytocic administration)(yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Non-pharmacological analgesia (yes/no); Pharmacological analgesia (including nitrous oxide, narcotic analgesia, regional analgesia, general analgesia) (yes/no for each of these outcomes) [five separate outcomes]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During a first or second stage of labour by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Duration of each stage of labour (minutes)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Mode of birth (non-instrumental vaginal birth / instrumental vaginal birth / caesarean section)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Water birth (planned / unplanned / head only born underwater) [primary outcome]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The highest maternal temperature in labour (degrees Celsius)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During first or second stage of labour by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maternal collapse requiring resuscitation (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Mother treated with antibiotics (yes / no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During labour or prior to postnatal hospital discharge by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Perineal status (intact, 1st, 2nd, 3rd, or 4th degree tears, episiotomy)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Management of third stage labour (active/physiological)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of third stage labour by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Estimated blood loss in the immediate postpartum period (millilitres); Major postpartum haemorrhage >1500mL and/or requiring operative procedure and/or maternal blood transfusion (yes / no); Maternal blood transfusion of three or more units of blood (yes/no) [three separate outcomes]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During labour or prior to postnatal hospital discharge by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maternal admission to intensive-care unit/high dependency unit (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Length of stay in hospital for mothers following birth (days)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On postnatal discharge from hospital by extraction from hospital's patient management (iPM) database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maternal readmission to hospital (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Following discharge from hospital and within 6 weeks of giving birth by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maternal death
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During labour or within 6 weeks of giving birth by extraction from hospital's patient management (iPM) database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Perinatal death (stillbirth or neonatal death excluding lethal congenital anomalies)(yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During labour or prior to discharge from hospital by extraction from the hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Birth weight (grams)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Gestational age at birth (weeks)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Intrapartum abnormal heart rate pattern (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: During first or second stage labour by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Meconium-stained liquor (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At any time following rupture of membranes until birth of the baby by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Positive pressure ventilation (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Snapped cord during birth (yes / no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Neonatal blood transfusion (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At any point following birth and prior to hospital discharge by extraction from hospital's neonatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Cord pH <7.00 and/or base deficit <-10 (arterial cord blood) (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Resuscitation which includes intubation for ventilation, cardiac massage and/or the administration of drugs of resuscitation (e.g. Adrenaline, Sodium Bicarbonate, Fluids) (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Apgar score < 7 at 5 minutes (yes/no) ; Apgar score < 4 at 5 minutes (yes/no) [two outcomes]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Five minutes after birth by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Admitted to a neonatal nursery (yes/no); Admitted to a neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) (yes/no) [two outcomes]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Admitted to a special care or NICU for > 4 days (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On discharge from hospital by extraction from hospital's patient management (iPM)database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Length of stay in neonatal nursery (days)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On discharge from neonatal nursery by extraction from hospital's patient management (iPM) database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Length of neonatal hospital stay (days)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On discharge from hospital by extraction from hospital's patient management (iPM) database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Neonatal readmission to hospital (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Any time from hospital discharge until 28 days of age from hospital's patient management (iPM) database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Any type of birth injury (recorded by diagnosis)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Serious neonatal adverse event - composite outcome: stillbirth/fetal death in labour after study entry; death of a live born infant before discharge from hospital; resuscitation, which includes intubation for ventilation, cardiac massage and/or the administration of drugs of resuscitation (e.g. Adrenaline, Sodium Bicarbonate, Fluids); hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy (HIE) 2 or 3; seizures under 48 hours; Apgar score < 4 at 5 minutes; admission to NICU > 4 days (96 hours); proven systemic infection in first 48 hours of life (treated with antibiotics)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Prior to discharge from hospital by extraction from hospital's electronic neonatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Breastfeeding initiation at birth (yes/no)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Infant feeding at hospital discharge (breastfeeding/formula/breast and formula/breast and expressed breast milk/expressed milk/gavage/not applicable)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On postnatal discharge from hospital by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Neonatal temperature at birth (degrees Celsius)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On completion of birth episode by extraction from hospital's electronic perinatal database

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Pain during labour and birth, satisfaction with birth experience, water birth intention, reasons for not having a water birth, experiences of water birth, neonatal health problems including re-admission to hospital [six outcomes]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At 6 weeks postpartum by survey using 10-point numerical rating scales, 4-point Likert scales, categorical and free-text responses

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Staff baseline characteristics, knowledge, attitudes, experiences and satisfaction with caring for women planning a water birth [five outcomes]
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: By electronic survey using 5-point Likert scales, categorical and free-text responses during data collection

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - 15 years or older - do not require interpreter - weigh less than 100 kilograms - low obstetric risk - suitable for intermittent auscultation in labour - singleton viable pregnancy - admitted to birth suite in spontaneous labour at term - vertex presentation - intact membranes or draining clear liquor (PROM <24 hours) - maternal and fetal observations within normal limits - vaginal bleeding within normal limits (i.e. no more than a 'show')
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - 14 years or younger - require an interpreter or legal guardian for consent - weigh 100 kilograms or more - obstetric risk factors - not suitable for intermittent auscultation in labour - multiple pregnancy or fetal demise - blood born infection e.g. Hepatitis B, C and HIV - major congenital anomalies - admitted to birth suite in labour <37+0 or >42 weeks' gestation - induction or planned caesarean - non-vertex presentation - meconium-stained liquor - abnormal maternal or fetal observations - any suspected or proven active infectious illness - requesting narcotic or epidural analgesia - any contraindication to intermittent fetal heart rate monitoring - vaginal bleeding more than 'show'

trial_design.statisticalmethods:
Feasibility outcomes Simple descriptive statistics will be used to analyse the feasibility outcomes. Interim reporting of recruitment data will occur monthly. It will be considered feasible to conduct the main study if at least 25% of eligible women are recruited, and at least 50% of women who intend to water birth proceed to give birth under water.
Clinical outcomes Clinical outcome data will be analysed using StataSE (Version 12) software. Basic descriptive statistics with confidence intervals with be calculated and reported as this feasibility study is not powered for any clinical outcomes.
Survey data Survey data will be analysed using univariate statistics in StataSE (Version 12) software. Descriptive statistics will be calculated for all variables, including mean, median, standard deviation, range, and percentages as appropriate. Categorical data will be analysed using Chi square. Thematic analysis of free text responses will also be conducted. The response rate will also be calculated and reported.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Water birth occurs when a baby is born fully submerged in water. There is a lack of strong (Level 1) evidence to conclusively agree on the safety or risk of water birth. We aim to determine if it is possible to run a large study that examines the safety of water birth compared to land birth in women with low-risk pregnancies. In this study, we will test recruitment parameters, research processes, and outcome measures (for mother and baby) to assess the feasibility of a main study. If this study proves feasible and funding is obtained, then we will consider an international study across multiple sites (subject to ethical approval) with the primary purpose of testing safety for babies who are born under water.
